data.flavorText: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.

data.name: Unown

abilities.name: FLASH
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown from your hand onto your Bench, you may look at the top 5 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

data.flavorText: Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape appears to have some meaning.

attacks.name: Collapse
attacks.text: Dewgong is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.

data.name: Haunter

abilities.name: Transparency
abilities.text: Whenever an attack does anything to Haunter, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Haunter. This power stops working while Haunter is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

data.name: Palpitoad

attacks.name: Twirling Sign

data.flavorText: It weakens its prey with sound waves intense enough to cause headaches, then entangles them with its sticky tongue.

data.name: White Kyurem-GX

attacks.name: Shred

data.name: Blaine's Last Stand
rules: You can play this card only when it is the last card in your hand.
Draw 2 cards for each Fire Pokémon you have in play.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.flavorText: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.

attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent discards 1 Energy card, if any, attached to that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.

data.name: Murkrow

attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Murkrows on your Bench. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.

data.name: Pachirisu

attacks.text: For each of your Benched Pokémon that has the Nuzzle attack, search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

data.name: Articuno

abilities.name: Aurora Veil
abilities.text: As long as Articuno is your Active Pokémon, your Benched Pokémon do not take damage from and are not affected by attacks. This power cannot be used if Articuno is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.

data.name: Porygon

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: More and more people play the slots every day, trying to win a Porygon.

data.name: Gligar

attacks.name: Rock Cannon
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Bagon.

data.name: Mantine

attacks.name: Water Reserve

data.flavorText: If it builds up enough speed swimming, it can jump out above the waves and glide for over 300 feet.

data.name: Metapod

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 20 or less damage is done to Metapod (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen).

attacks.name: Hatch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove all damage counters from Metapod. Then, search your deck for a card that evolves from Metapod and attach that card to Metapod. This counts as evolving Metapod. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: Inside the shell, it is soft and weak as it prepares to evolve. It stays motionless in the shell.

data.name: Gligar

attacks.name: Stun Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It flies straight at its target's face then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.

data.flavorText: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does a strange dance to control foes' minds.

data.flavorText: It bounces playfully like a ball. The more seawater it swallows, the higher it bounces.

attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put a card from your hand back on your deck. attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.flavorText: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a "Signpost for Wandering Spirits."

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: In the distant past, it was stronger than its horribly weak descendants that exist today.

attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, discard an Energy attached to that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its body is said to be harder than any kind of metal. A study has revealed that its body is hollow.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fortunate Eye
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your opponent's deck and put them back on top of his or her deck in any order.

data.flavorText: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.

data.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Magnetic Resonance
attacks.text: If you have a Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Magnetic Release
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Brush Off
attacks.text: Put the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it on top of your opponent's deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward. (If your opponent doesn't have any Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing.)

data.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Raichu during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Raichu.

data.flavorText: It can loose 100,000-volt bursts of electricity, instantly downing foes several times its size.

data.name: Light Ninetales

attacks.name: Guiding Flame
attacks.text: Put a Baby Pokémon or a Basic Pokémon card from your discard pile onto your Bench. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Light Ninetales in order to use this attack.

data.flavorText: It is said that each of its nine tails contains a different magical power.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Energy Reaction
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you attach a Grass or Psychic Energy card from your hand to Vileplume (excluding effects of attacks or Poké-Powers), you may use this power. If you attach a Grass Energy card, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If you attach a Psychic Energy card, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Vileplume is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Disturbing Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.

data.name: Carbink

abilities.name: Energy Keeper
abilities.text: Basic Energy attached to your Basic Pokémon can't be discarded by effects of your opponent's attacks, Abilities, or Trainer cards.

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It's occasionally found during the excavation of caves.

data.name: Persian

attacks.name: Pounce
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Persian during your next turn, any damage done by the attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

data.flavorText: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

data.name: Diglett

attacks.name: Mine
attacks.text: Look at the top card of your opponent's deck. Then, you may have your opponent shuffle his or her deck.

data.flavorText: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.

data.name: Slowpoke

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: There are some places where Slowpoke is worshiped because of a long-standing belief that whenever Slowpoke yawns, it rains.

attacks.name: Slow-Acting Poison
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Grumpig

abilities.name: Own Tempo
abilities.text: This Pokémon can't be Confused.

attacks.name: Psych Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Psych Up attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does a strange dance to control foes' minds.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Wigglytuff by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a Body Slam.

attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and discard it.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Electrisilk
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has no Retreat Cost, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.

attacks.name: Spin Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.text: You may switch Kirlia with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.

data.flavorText: Unsanitary places are what they like best. They can be spotted in Alola, often with Grimer in hot pursuit.

data.name: Nidorino

attacks.name: Fury Attack

data.flavorText: It is easily angered. By swinging its well-developed horn wildly, it can even punch through diamond.

data.name: Victini

attacks.name: V-Beatdown
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Basic Pokémon in play.

data.flavorText: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being's entire body will be overflowing with power.

data.name: Primeape

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spirited Throw
attacks.text: If, before doing damage, your opponent's Active Pokémon has more remaining HP than this Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: It is always outrageously furious. If it gives chase, it will tenaciously track the target no matter how far.

data.name: Battle City
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may flip a coin. If heads, the player draws a card.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Quilava

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Quilava in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Fire Wind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them. Flip 2 coins. For each heads, this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.)

data.flavorText: This Pokémon is fully covered by nonflammable fur. It can withstand any kind of fire attack.

data.name: Larvitar

attacks.name: Mountain Eater
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck. Then, remove 2 damage counters from Larvitar.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: Larvitar does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.

attacks.name: Sharp Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Lanturn

abilities.name: Energy Grounding
abilities.text: When 1 of your Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move a basic Energy card from that Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.

attacks.name: Wreck
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Flames of Rage
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Primeape. This attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each damage counter on Primeape.

data.name: Luxio

attacks.name: Fasten Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Thunder Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.

data.name: Spinda

attacks.name: Synchro Removal
attacks.text: If any Energy card attached to Spinda is the same type as any Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon, discard 1 of those Energy cards from the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pulled Punch
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack's base damage is 10 instead of 30.

data.flavorText: No two Spinda have the same pattern of spots. Its tottering step fouls the aim of foes.

data.name: Machop
data.flavorText: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.

data.name: Eelektross

attacks.name: Dark Clamp
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Vacuum Bolt
attacks.text: You may do 80 more damage. If you do, this attack does 80 damage to 1 of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.

data.name: Electabuzz
data.flavorText: Research is progressing on storing lightning in Electabuzz so this energy can be used at any time.

data.name: Magcargo

abilities.name: Magma Armor
abilities.text: Magcargo can't be Asleep or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Lava Plume
attacks.text: You may discard the top card of your deck. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: Its body temperature is roughly 18,000 degrees F. Flames spout from gaps in its hardened shell.

data.name: Carracosta

abilities.name: Ancient Custom
abilities.text: Pokémon Tool cards attached to your opponent's Pokémon have no effect.

attacks.name: Aqua Impact
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: Its jaws are terrifyingly powerful. It could eat Omastar and Omanyte whole and not be bothered in the slightest by their shells.

data.name: Komala

abilities.name: Comatose
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever you attach an Energy from your hand to it, it is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Hypno Roll
attacks.text: This attack can be used if this Pokémon is Asleep. If it is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.

data.name: Ralts
data.flavorText: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.

data.name: Venipede

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.

data.name: Nidoking

attacks.name: Rumble
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Tail Swing
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It is recognized by its rock-hard hide and its extended horn. Be careful with the horn as it contains venom.

attacks.name: Miracle Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Condition (Asleep, Burned, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned). The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Roasting Heat
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Burned, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Trubbish

attacks.name: Garbage Collection
attacks.text: Put a card from your discard pile on top of your deck.

data.flavorText: The combination of garbage bags and industrial waste caused the chemical reaction that created this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Risky Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Dragon Eye
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Volcarona

abilities.name: Scorching Scales
abilities.text: Put 4 damage counters instead of 2 on your opponent's Burned Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Burning Wind
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: A sea of fire engulfs the surroundings of their battles, since they use their six wings to scatter their ember scales.

data.name: Dugtrio

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Mini-Metronome
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Mini-Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) (No matter what type that Pokémon is, Togepi's type is still Colorless.) Togepi performs that attack.

data.name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magnemite does 40 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses attacks like Thunder Wave.

data.name: Light Slowbro

attacks.name: Fish Out
attacks.text: Your opponent may choose up to 3 Baby Pokémon, Basic Pokémon, and/or Evolution cards from his or her discard pile and shuffle them into his or her deck. Either way, you may do the same.

attacks.name: Splash About
attacks.text: If there are more Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon than to Light Slowbro, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage. If not, this attack does 20 damage.

data.flavorText: If the Shellder attached to its tail becomes separated, this Pokémon reverts to a normal Slowpoke.

data.name: Ivysaur

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: When the bulb on its back grows large, the Pokémon seems to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

data.name: Garbodor

attacks.name: Trashalanche
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Item card in your opponent's discard pile.

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Beware the poisonous liquid it shoots from its right arm. If even a little of it gets on you, you'll experience the effects of the unidentified toxin.

data.name: Primeape

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Primeape is now Confused (after doing damage).

data.flavorText: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until its quarry is caught.

data.name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Guard
abilities.text: As long as Snorlax is your Active Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon can't Retreat. This power stops working when Snorlax is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Roll Over
attacks.text: Snorlax is now Asleep. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

data.name: Carbink

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon-EX.

data.flavorText: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It's occasionally found during the excavation of caves.

data.name: Eternatus V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Power Accelerator
attacks.text: You may attach a Darkness Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dynamax Cannon
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon VMAX, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Hyper Potion
rules: Heal 120 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has at least 2 Energy attached. If you healed any damage in this way, discard 2 Energy from it.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

abilities.name: Streaming Mantle
abilities.text: When you play Magcargo from your hand to evolve your Active Pokémon, you may discard the top 3 cards of your deck and and then shuffle 3 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck. If you do, your opponent does the same.

attacks.name: Crushing Lava
attacks.text: You may discard a Fire or Fighting basic Energy card attached to Magcargo. If you discard a Fire Energy card in this way, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned. If you discard a Fighting Energy card in this way, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Grand Loop
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards. You may switch Yanma with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spinning Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Tynamo

attacks.name: Charge Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: These Pokémon move in schools. They have an electricity-generating organ, so they discharge electricity if in danger.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Electrike
data.flavorText: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.

data.name: Brock's Grit
rules: Shuffle 6 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Litleo

abilities.name: Wild Dash
abilities.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.

data.name: Grimer

attacks.name: Sticky Liquid
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

data.flavorText: Wherever Grimer has passed, so many germs are left behind that no plants will ever grow again.

data.name: Wailord

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 4 damage counters from Wailord. Wailord is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Giant Wave
attacks.text: Wailord can't use Giant Wave during your next turn.

data.flavorText: The biggest of all Pokémon. It can dive to a depth of almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.

data.name: Anorith

attacks.name: Guard Claw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Anorith by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon ancestor that was reanimated from a fossil. It lived in the sea and hunted with claws.

data.name: Klefki

attacks.name: Look for Keys
attacks.text: Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal an Item card. Put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Play Rough
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.

data.name: Togedemaru

attacks.name: Electrosmash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.

data.name: Kyogre-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Giant Whirlpool
attacks.text: Return 2 Water Energy attached to this Pokémon to your hand.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If you played Beedrill G from your hand during this turn, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 10.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Prowl
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Persian from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Snap Tail
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Vigorous Aura
abilities.text: As long as Vigoroth is your Active Pokémon, attacks by each player's Active Pokémon (both if there are 2) do 10 more damage to any Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Pickup Power
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

data.name: Cosmog

attacks.name: Dust Gathering
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.

data.name: Larvitar
data.flavorText: It is born deep underground. It can't emerge until it has entirely consumed the soil around it.

attacks.name: Dig Under
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: Does damage to the Defending Pokémon equal to half the Defending Pokémon's remaining HP (rounded up to the nearest 10).

data.name: Gothitelle

abilities.name: Teleport Room
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard any Stadium card in play. If you do, put a Stadium card with a different name from your discard pile into play.

attacks.name: Psy Report
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

data.flavorText: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.

data.name: Zubat

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It does not need eyes, because it emits ultrasonic waves to check its surrounding while it flies.

data.name: Marshtomp

attacks.name: Muddy Bomb
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon and 10 damage to each of your opponent's other Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its sturdy legs give it sure footing, even in mud. It burrows into dirt to sleep.

data.name: Vaporeon

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Vaporeon.

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: When Vaporeon's fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.

data.name: Zygarde

attacks.name: Rumble
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Raging Blade
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: It's thought to be monitoring the ecosystem. There are rumors that even greater power lies hidden within it.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Auto Fire
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Thunder Snipe
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon, and this attack does 160 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon V or Pokémon-GX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

data.name: Caterpie
data.flavorText: Its feet have suction cups designed to stick to any surface. It tenaciously climbs trees to forage.

data.name: Gengar & Mimikyu-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. This attack does 50 damage for each Trainer card you find there.

attacks.name: Horror House-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any cards from their hand during their next turn. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Psychic Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), each player draws cards until they have 7 cards in their hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Metang

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its two brains are linked, amplifying its psychic power.

data.name: Shinx

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

data.name: Omastar

attacks.name: Squeeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Spike Barrage
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Water Energy attached to Omastar. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Apparently, it cracked Shellder's shell with its sharp fangs and sucked out the insides.

data.name: Froakie
data.flavorText: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

data.name: Dodrio

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Triple Pick
attacks.text: Choose 3 of your opponent's Evolved Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: When DODUO evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.

data.name: Vanillish

attacks.name: Freezing Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: By drinking pure water, it grows its icy body. This Pokémon can be hard to find on days with warm, sunny weather.

data.name: Rotom

abilities.name: Roto Motor
abilities.text: If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

attacks.name: Plasma Slice
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

data.name: Shining Jirachi

attacks.name: Stellar Reign
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an evolved Pokémon, devolve it by putting all of the Evolution cards on it into your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: Generations have believed that any wish written on a note on its head will come true when it awakens.

data.name: Nosepass

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its magnetic nose consistently faces north. Travelers check Nosepass to get their bearings.

data.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Removal Pulse
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.

data.name: Cresselia

abilities.name: Lunar Aura
abilities.text: If you have Darkrai in play, remove 1 damage counter from Cresselia between turns.

attacks.name: Lunar Flight
attacks.text: Does 80 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Cresselia.

data.flavorText: On nights around the quarter moon, the aurora from its tail extends and undulates beautifully.

data.name: Chimecho

attacks.name: Bell of Silence
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Pokémon that has an Ability from their hand during their next turn.

data.flavorText: It uses the sucker on its head to hang from a tree or from eaves. It can produce seven different tones.

abilities.name: Extra Wing
abilities.text: The Retreat Cost for each of your Stage 2 Pokémon-ex is 0.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Swellow during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Headache
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play Trainer cards during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokémon will use psychokinetic powers.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Charmander.

data.name: Gliscor

attacks.name: Submission Hold
attacks.text: Your opponent can't attach Energy from his or her hand to the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

data.name: Lombre

attacks.name: Interrupt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand and choose 1 card, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

data.flavorText: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.

data.name: Slowbro

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Three Strikes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads. If all of them are tails, you lose this game.

data.flavorText: Spacing out is basically all it does. It turns back into Slowpoke if its tail, along with Shellder, breaks off.

data.name: Munna

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Munna always float in the air. People whose dreams are eaten by them forget what the dreams had been about.

data.name: Paras

attacks.name: Sleep Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It is doused with mushroom spores when it is born. As its body grows, mushrooms sprout from its back.

data.name: Quilava

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Char
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon doesn't have a Char counter on it, flip a coin. If heads, put a Char counter on it. A Char counter requires your opponent to flip a coin after every turn. If tails, put 2 damage counters on the Pokémon with that Char counter. (Char counters stay on the Pokémon as long as it's in play.)

data.flavorText: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.

data.name: Scyther

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It is nearly impossible to parry its attacking scythes. Its movements are like a ninja's.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Natural Cure
abilities.text: When you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Marshtomp, remove all Special Conditions from Marshtomp.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Ice Throw
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Fighting, this attack's base damage is doubled.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Misty's Dewgong does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Data Retrieval
attacks.text: If you have less than 4 cards in your hand, draw cards until you have 4 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Cryogonal

attacks.name: Frozen Lock
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from their hand during their next turn.

data.flavorText: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.

data.name: Gothita
data.flavorText: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.

data.name: Miltank

attacks.name: Healing Milk
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, remove 3 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It is said that kids who drink MILTANK's milk grow up to become hearty, healthy adults.

data.name: Piplup

attacks.name: Bubble Hold
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It doesn't like to be taken care of. It's difficult to bond with since it won't listen to its Trainer.

data.name: Machoke

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 40 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke.

data.flavorText: MACHOKE's boundless power is very dangerous, so it wears a belt that suppresses its energy.

data.name: Ralts
data.flavorText: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

data.name: Gorebyss

ancientTrait.name: α Growth
ancientTrait.text: When you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon (except with an attack, Ability, or Trainer card), you may attach 2 Energy cards.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its swimming form is exquisitely elegant. With its thin mouth, it feeds on seaweed that grows between rocks.

data.name: Electivire

attacks.name: Electriwave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Shock Wave
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: The instant it presses the tips of its tails onto an opponent, it sends over 20,000 volts of electricity into the foe.

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.text: If Metang has any Energy attached to it, Metang's Retreat Cost is 0.

data.name: Seismitoad

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Resonance
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Confused, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.flavorText: The vibrating of the bumps all over its body causes earthquake-like tremors. Seismitoad and Croagunk are similar species.

data.name: Keldeo V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Secret Sword
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Natu
data.flavorText: It picks food from cactus plants, deftly avoiding buds and spines. It seems to skip about to move.

data.name: Type: Null

attacks.name: Armor Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.

data.name: Scraggy

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling it skin up to its neck.

attacks.name: Sniff Out
attacks.text: Put any 1 card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Shellder

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hide in Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Shellder during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

data.flavorText: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

data.name: Drifblim

attacks.name: Shadow Steal
attacks.text: Does 50 damage times the number of Special Energy cards in your opponent's discard pile.

attacks.name: Plentiful Placement
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: At dusk, swarms of them are carried aloft on winds. When noticed, they suddenly vanish.

data.name: Houndoom

attacks.name: Dark Clamp
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Blazing Claws
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Team Plasma Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage, and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: The flames it breathes when angry contain toxins. If they cause a burn, it will hurt forever.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Crushing Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Staravia

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.

data.name: Camerupt

attacks.name: Eruption
attacks.text: Each player discards the top of his or her deck. This attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Camerupt does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It has volcanoes on its back. If magma builds up in its body, it shudders, then erupts violently.

data.name: Roggenrola
data.flavorText: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.

data.name: Leafeon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Breath of the Leaves
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 50 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Grand Bloom-GX
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Basic Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.name: Suction Cups
abilities.text: As long as Octillery is your Active Pokémon, whenever the Defending Pokémon retreats, discard all Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon when it goes to the Bench.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Magmar
data.flavorText: It dislikes cold places, so it blows scorching flames to make the environment suitable for itself.

data.name: Kirlia

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.

data.name: Slowking

attacks.name: Drift Ashore
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Unarmed
attacks.text: If you have no cards in your hand, ignore all Energy in this attack's cost.

data.flavorText: A poisonous bite reacted with its system, blessing it with the enhanced intellect of a genius. It has full control of its psychic powers.

data.name: Bronzor

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: There are researchers who believe this Pokémon reflected like a mirror in the distant past.

data.name: Manectric

abilities.name: Electric Start
abilities.text: If you go second, and if this Pokémon is in your hand when you are setting up to play, you may put it face down as your Active Pokémon or on your Bench.

attacks.name: Double Charge
attacks.text: You may attach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.

abilities.name: Rain Dish
abilities.text: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Lombre.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Metagross

abilities.name: Plasma Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Team Plasma card, reveal it, and put it in your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. You may not use an Ability with the same name during your turn.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: With four linked brains, it's more intelligent than a supercomputer, and it uses calculations to analyze foes.

data.name: Weepinbell

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Corrode Target
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand, choose 1 card, and discard it.

data.flavorText: Even though it is filled with acid, it does not melt because it also oozes a protective fluid.

data.name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Belly Drum
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on Poliwhirl. If this doesn't Knock Out Poliwhirl, search your deck for 2 Basic Energy cards and attach them to Poliwhirl. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwhirl but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

data.flavorText: The swirl on its belly undulates. Staring at it may gradually cause drowsiness.

data.name: Seel
data.flavorText: It has always been supposed that Seel live only in cold seas. Their having shown up in Alola is a mystery.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Pupitar does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Whirlipede

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.

data.name: Prinplup

attacks.name: Direct Dive
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.

abilities.name: Tailwind
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dragonite is on your Bench, you may reduce your Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost to 0.

attacks.name: Dragon Tail
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Keldeo-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Pure Heart
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX.

attacks.name: Sonic Edge
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Resolute Blade-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Liability
attacks.text: Put damage counters on the Defending Pokémon until it is 10 HP away from being Knocked Out. Weezing does 70 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Smogscreen
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Vanilluxe

abilities.name: Bitter Cold
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: When its anger reaches a breaking point, this Pokémon unleashes a fierce blizzard that freezes every creature around it, be they friend or foe.

data.name: Darkrai

abilities.name: Darkness Aura
abilities.text: If you have Cresselia in play, each of Darkrai's attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: To protect itself, it afflicts those around it with nightmares. However, it means no harm.

data.name: Dunsparce

attacks.name: Snake Hook
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Bite and Run
attacks.text: Switch Dunsparce with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It digs into the ground with its tail and makes a mazelike nest. It can fly just a little.

data.name: Musharna

attacks.name: Hypnotic Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.

data.name: Nidoran ♀

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Although small, its venomous barbs render this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

data.name: Metapod

abilities.name: Emerge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Metapod is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from Metapod and put it onto Metapod. (This counts as evolving Metapod.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Metapod is affected by a Special Condition.

data.flavorText: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.

data.name: Ampharos V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Damaging Spark
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Nidoking BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Nidoking BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Toxic Drill
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

data.name: Sobble
data.flavorText: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won't be able to resist weeping.

attacks.name: Tender Tentacles
attacks.text: If Lileep has any React Energy cards attached to it, remove 2 damage counters from Lileep.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Metapod

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Metapod during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It is vulnerable to attack because its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

attacks.name: Leaf Slice
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Magmar

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Magmar in order to use this attack.

data.flavorText: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

data.name: Brock's Pewter City Gym
rules: Onix-GX (both yours and your opponent's) take 40 less damage from the opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Xatu

attacks.name: Fortunate Draw
attacks.text: You and your opponent play Rock-Paper-Scissors. The player who wins draws 3 cards. The player who loses discards the top 3 cards of his or her deck.

attacks.name: Miracle Wing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun's movement all day.

data.name: Light Vaporeon

attacks.name: Wash Away
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, remove all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon and discard all Energy cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Hypnoshower
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. Remove 1 damage counter from each Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's) with any damage counters on it.

data.flavorText: If its fins being to vibrate, it is a sign that it will begin raining soon.

data.name: Tynamo

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: These Pokémon move in schools. They have an electricity-generating organ, so they discharge electricity if in danger.

data.name: Turtonator

attacks.name: Explosive Jet
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Fire Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: It gushes fire and poisonous gases from its nostrils. Its dung is an explosive substance and can be put to various uses.

attacks.name: Magnetic Lines
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, move a basic Energy card from the Defending Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon. (Ignore this effect if your opponent has only 1 Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Energy Milk
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Shadow Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 30 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Attract Energy
abilities.text: When you play Magneton from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may move any number of basic Energy cards attached to your other Pokémon to Magneton.

attacks.name: Electric Blast
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Magneton when you use this attack. If you do, put damage counters equal to the amount of Energy cards removed in this way on any number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon in the way you like. (For example, if you discard 3 Lightning Energy cards, you can put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and 2 on another.)

attacks.name: Charm
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Kyogre

attacks.name: Spring Tides
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Ocean Cyclone
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: A mythical Pokémon said to have swelled the seas with rain and tidal waves. It battled with Groudon.

data.name: Galarian Darumaka

attacks.name: Ice Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It lived in snowy areas for so long that its fire sac cooled off and atrophied. It now has an organ that generates cold instead.

data.name: Chinchou

attacks.name: Searching Light
attacks.text: Look at 1 of your face-down Prize cards.

data.flavorText: It lives in the depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.

data.name: Garbodor

attacks.name: Gentle Wrap
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Gunk Shot
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: They absorb garbage and make it part of their bodies. They shoot poisonous liquid from their right-hand fingertips.

data.name: Muk

abilities.name: Toxic Sludge
abilities.text: At the end of each player's turn, each of your opponent's Active Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached to it is now Poisoned. If that Pokémon is already Poisoned, Toxic Sludge Poké-Body does nothing to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Panic Liquid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused and can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: A toxic fluids seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Kirlia

attacks.name: Calm Mind
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.
